entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is a character in the story who is present at the Burrow. He is described as having a muscle jumping in his jaw and nodding to Kingsley.

entities.name: tonks
entities.description: Tonks is a character in the story who asks Harry, Hermione, and Kingsley about their journeys.

entities.name: kingsley
entities.description: Kingsley is a character in the story who has to get back to Downing Street. He says goodbye to the others before Disapparating.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a character in the story who is present at the Burrow and recounts his journey with Hermione.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is a character in the story who is present at the Burrow and recounts her journey with Harry.

entities.name: bill
entities.description: Bill is a character mentioned in the story as being absent. His absence seems to be affecting the others.

entities.name: fleur
entities.description: Fleur is a character mentioned in the story as being absent. Her absence seems to be affecting the others.

entities.name: mad-eye
entities.description: Mad-eye is a character mentioned in the story as being absent. His absence seems to be affecting the others.

entities.name: mundungus
entities.description: Mundungus is a character mentioned in the story as being absent. His absence seems to be affecting the others.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a character in the story who is hugged by his parents before Lupin and Tonks arrive.

entities.name: ginny
entities.description: Ginny is a character in the story who comes down the back steps with her parents.

entities.name: downing street
entities.description: Downing Street is a location mentioned in the story as where Kingsley has to get back to. It seems to be some kind of important place for him.

relationships.description: Kingsley has to get back to Downing Street, indicating that it is his workplace or a place he needs to be for work.
Harry and Hermione recounted their journeys together, indicating that they traveled with each other.
